column1: '''''tië''''' (or ''tie''; pl. ''tier'' or ''tiër'') is a [[Quenya]] word meaning "path; road, way; course, line, direction".<ref>{{FR
The word derives from [[Primitive Quendian]] ''[[teȝē]]'', from [[Sundocarme
column3: TEȜ]]. Note that this stem was changed by [[J.R.R. Tolkien
undulávë]] [[lumbulë]]'' "all '''paths''' are drowned deep in shadow"<ref name=Namarie/>

column1: The word appears to be a direct loan from [[Finnish]] ''[[Wiktionary:tie#Finnish
column2: tie]]'' "road, way".<ref>Harri Perälä, "[http://www.sci.fi/~alboin/finn_que.htm Are High Elves Finno-Ugric?]" (see especially the chapter "Vocabulary"), dated 7 May 2005, at [http://www.sci.fi/~alboin/jrrtmenu.htm Studies on the Works of J.R.R. Tolkien] (accessed 13 June 2011)</ref>

column1: In the ''Qenya Lexicon'' appears the [[Qenya]] word ''tie'' ("line, direction, route, road").<ref>{{PE
